page.title: 01The Northamptonshire Uplands
page.content: This unknown part of England is chiefly noted for its pleasant rollig countryside and attractive villages. Everdon is such a village, named as such from the time when wild boars roamed the hillsides around here. In the valley, the land is used for growing crops such as wheat, barley and oil-seed rape, while on the higher land sheep are grazed. Surrounding the village are a number of stables where horses are trained for steeple-chasing. The old school has been turned into a much used county field centre. Many of the people living in this area have jobs elsewhere and use their cottages at weekends only, although others use Everdon as a dormatory village. As settlement is so sparse there is little objection to Motor cycle Scrmbling taking place on sundays,
